title: Examen: Objetivos de Ahorro y Presupuestos

questions.question: We need to reduce our ___ this month to save more money.
questions.explanation: Para ahorrar más dinero, es necesario reducir los gastos (expenses).

questions.question: I ___ to start a new business venture next year.
questions.explanation: El sujeto 'I' requiere la forma 'am going to' para planes futuros.

questions.question: What is your primary financial ___ for this year?
questions.explanation: Un objetivo (goal) es el fin al que se dirige una acción financiera.

questions.question: Is he ___ invest in the international stock market?
questions.explanation: La forma interrogativa del futuro con intención es 'Is he going to...?'.

questions.question: Your ___ is the total amount of money you receive monthly.
questions.explanation: El ingreso (income) es el dinero que se recibe, generalmente por trabajo.

questions.question: A ___ is a detailed plan for how you will spend your money.
questions.explanation: Un presupuesto (budget) es un plan financiero para controlar gastos e ingresos.

questions.question: They ___ buy a new house if they save enough money.
questions.explanation: El sujeto plural 'They' requiere la forma 'are going to'.

questions.question: Buying a house in five years is a long-term ___.
questions.explanation: Una meta a largo plazo se define como un objetivo o 'goal'.

questions.question: It is important to ___ your daily spending to stay within budget.
questions.explanation: Rastrear (track) los gastos ayuda a no exceder el presupuesto.

questions.question: She ___ going to waste her savings on luxury items.
questions.explanation: El sujeto 'She' requiere la forma negativa singular 'isn't'.

questions.question: A savings ___ allows you to earn interest on your money.
questions.explanation: Una cuenta (account) de ahorros es donde guardas dinero para el futuro.

questions.question: We are going to ___ our expenses by 15% this quarter.
questions.explanation: Recortar (cut) los gastos significa reducirlos para ahorrar.

questions.question: ___ you going to open a new investment portfolio?
questions.explanation: Para el sujeto 'you' en preguntas, usamos el auxiliar 'Are'.

questions.question: Rent and electricity are examples of monthly ___.
questions.explanation: El alquiler y la luz son costos recurrentes o gastos (expenses).

questions.question: He is ___ to apply for a mortgage next month.
questions.explanation: La estructura de futuro planeado requiere 'going to'.

questions.question: Your ___ should not be higher than your income.
questions.explanation: Tus gastos (expenses) no deben superar a tus ingresos para evitar deudas.

questions.question: How are you going to ___ your financial objectives?
questions.explanation: Lograr o alcanzar (achieve) es el verbo adecuado para objetivos.

questions.question: We need to stay ___ our monthly budget.
questions.explanation: Mantenerse 'dentro' (within) del presupuesto es fundamental.

questions.question: My ___ is to save 20% of my salary every month.
questions.explanation: Ahorrar una parte del salario es un objetivo (goal) financiero.

questions.question: Are they going to ___ their debts before the end of the year?
questions.explanation: Saldar o pagar (pay off) deudas es una acción financiera común.
